title: Build full Rainbowz Mind Studio marketing website frontend (React + Tailwind)

requirements.text: Implement the full multi-page marketing website frontend for “Rainbowz Mind Studio” using React + TypeScript and Tailwind CSS, based on the approved information architecture and page layouts: Home, About, Our Method, Programs, Results & Outcomes, Parents’ Guide, and Contact / Book Demo.

quotes: tart building the full frontend application in React + Tailwind

acceptanceCriteria: All 7 pages exist and are navigable via client-side routing.
Each page renders the sections described in the approved wireframes (hero, grids/cards, diagrams/visual metaphors, testimonials/proof where specified, and CTAs).
Navigation includes links to all primary pages and works on mobile and desktop.
All pages are responsive and visually consistent.

requirements.text: Create shared layout and UI building blocks to ensure consistency across all pages: Navbar, Footer, Container/Section primitives, headings/subheadings, buttons (primary/secondary), card variants, grid presets, and reusable CTA blocks.
acceptanceCriteria: Shared components are used across pages (no duplicated markup for the same patterns).
Primary and secondary buttons have consistent styling and hover/focus states.
Spacing rhythm is consistent across sections and pages.

requirements.text: Apply the provided UI style guide as the site-wide design system in Tailwind (colors, typography, spacing, and overall “calm scientific” aesthetic). Use English for all user-facing text.

quotes: Full UI style guide (colors, fonts, spacing)

acceptanceCriteria: Global styling matches the specified palette and typography (Inter-like sans-serif, strong headings, readable body).
Section spacing follows the defined vertical rhythm (roughly 80–100px between major sections on desktop, appropriately reduced on mobile).
All user-facing copy is in English and matches the provided short-form copy where supplied (e.g., Home hero headline and CTAs).

requirements.text: Implement the “Our Method” page with the specified structure and visuals: system overview diagram (Technique → Brain Skill → Better Learning), four brain-skill cards (Focus, Working Memory, Processing Speed, Creativity), technique category blocks (high-level only), age-wise development staircase (5–7, 8–10, 11–14), simple science network graphic (dots/lines), and a two-column comparison table (Traditional vs Rainbowz).
acceptanceCriteria: The page includes all required sections in the stated order (or an equally clear logical order).
Techniques are presented as categories without revealing proprietary step-by-step activities.
The comparison section is a clear 2-column layout with 4 comparison points maximum.
Visuals favor diagrams/abstract graphics over cartoon brains or heavy academic visuals.

requirements.text: Implement the Programs page with an age-group selector (5–7, 8–10, 11–14) and corresponding program detail sections including: what this age needs (1-line), skills trained, weekly structure, and a “Book Demo for This Age” CTA for each group, plus a concise FAQ strip.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can easily scan/select each age group and view its details.
Each age group section includes the required sub-blocks and CTA.
FAQ strip displays 4–5 concise questions in an easy-to-scan UI (e.g., accordions or compact list).

requirements.text: Implement the Contact / Book Demo page with a form that captures: parent name, child age, phone, and preferred time, plus a “Map-like” visual block and alternate contact options (call and WhatsApp) rendered as UI elements (non-functional placeholders if no integration is provided).

quotes: CONTACT / BOOK DEMO — FULL FRONTEND LAYOUT

acceptanceCriteria: Form inputs exist for all required fields and perform basic client-side validation (required fields, simple phone format check).
Submitting the form provides a clear on-screen success state (e.g., confirmation panel) without requiring external services.
Alternate contact options are visible and styled consistently with the rest of the site.

requirements.text: Add a coherent, consistent visual theme across the site (calm scientific, child-friendly but not childish) using generous whitespace, bento-style cards, subtle geometric accents, thin-line iconography, and minimal abstract diagrams—ensuring the theme is applied consistently on every page.

quotes: calm scientific aesthetic that feels child‑friendly but not childish

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share the same visual language (cards, typography scale, icon style, section spacing).
Diagrams/visual metaphors appear as simple abstract graphics (lines, dots, arrows, rounded rectangles), not heavy illustrations.
No page introduces a conflicting color system, icon style, or spacing system.

requirements.text: Generate and include required static visual assets (abstract diagrams/illustrations and thin-line icons) as local static files under frontend/public/assets/generated, and render them in the relevant sections (Hero, Our Method diagrams, and generic iconography).

quotes: Visual style guidance: Clean, calm scientific aesthetic. Child photo + subtle cognitive‑themed abstract shapes.

acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are stored in frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend (no backend image routing).
Hero and Our Method sections display the generated visuals with proper responsive sizing and alt text.
No external image hotlinks are required for the core layout to look complete.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Frontend implementation must remain React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query (no Next.js).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Backend feature development in Motoko (no canister logic required for this marketing site build).
Third-party integrations for WhatsApp, maps, SMS, email, analytics, or CRM.
Long-form expanded copy beyond the provided short-form copy unless explicitly requested.

required: Abstract geometric hero overlay with cognitive-themed shapes (hero-overlay.dim_1600x900.png)
Thin-line icon set (focus, memory, speed, creativity, assess, train, strengthen, apply) in a consistent style (thinline-icons-sprite.dim_1024x1024.png)
Technique→Brain Skill→Better Learning diagram in calm scientific style (method-flow-diagram.dim_1400x400.png)
Minimal neural network dots/lines graphic with one accent node (science-network.dim_1200x600.png)

preferencesToAdd: Use English for user-facing website text
